page.title: 06Harvesting Trees At Mulben
page.content: When trees are planted by the Forestry Commission,they are planted very close together. As they grow towards the light and because they are so close to each other, they grow very tall and straight. The trees do not grow long branches because there is no room. The thinning of trees begins after about thirty years The other trees will be left to grow for sixty years. When they are cut down, the thick end of the trunk is sold to sawmills to be sawn into logs. The dividing line between thick and thin trunk is where the 16cm diameter comes. The thin part of the trunk might be exported to Norway or Sweden. There it is made into pulp for paper_making. Near Inverness there is a factory for making timber into chipboard.
